answers.answer: Hi,With regards to your night blindness, i suggest you seek consult with an ophthalmologist for a complete ophthalmologic assessment.At this point it is difficult to say if the BIH and the visual symptoms are related although it may possibly be so. But a thorough evaluation of the retina and other eye structures will be able to rule out eye problems.Nutritional deficiencies, other systemic problems like hypertension or diabetes mellitus also need to be ruled out.Do keep us posted regarding your physician's advice.
Thanks for that.  I will return to my family dostor and see if he can refer me to an ophthalmologist.  Thank you again for your time and advice

question: I have recently been diagnosed with BIH and i wanted to know if there is a connection between BIH and night blindness?  I first became ill in may 2006 and a couple of weeks previous i noticed a decline in my night vision.  I have spoken to my neurologist with regard to this but he wasnt interested.Thanks for your time!!!
title: Benign intracranial hypertension
